main event: In June 1957 in New Haven, Connecticut, a ground-visual observation of a pulsating sound was reported, and it was possibly caused by an aircraft. The object observed was described as a cigar-shaped, jet-sized, gray object with no wings or tail.
interesting points: The observation lasted 1 minute, and a pulsating sound was heard during the sighting.
The object was described as resembling a cigar in shape and similar in size to a jet, with a gray color.
Despite the report indicating a possible conventional explanation of the sighting, the lack of wings and tail on the object raised questions about its identification.
The sighting occurred during an overcast sky with broken light rain showers and ground fog, affecting visibility.
The observer was a civilian who reported the sighting via phone in New Haven.
sighted object: cigar-shaped, jet-sized, gray object with no wings or tail
